subject: Productivity
title: Shallow vs Deep Work
description: One-minute skill: Shallow vs Deep Work.

hook.text: Replying to emails feels productive. But it rarely creates anything new or valuable.

buildup.text: Shallow work is logistical: emails, scheduling, filing. It's necessary but easily replicated.

discovery.text: Deep work is creative: writing, coding, designing, strategizing. It produces irreplaceable output.

twist.text: Organizations reward responsiveness â€” a shallow work trait â€” while the deep work that matters goes unseen.

climax.text: Tracking how much time you spend on each type reveals where your real productivity stands.

punchline.text: Busy and productive are not the same thing.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between shallow and deep work?
options: Deep work creates irreplaceable output; shallow work is logistical
Shallow work is more important than deep work
